info.title: Microfox X SDK API
info.description: Single entry-point API for all Microfox X SDK functions via a wrapper Lambda

post.summary: Creates a new tweet on X with specified content and options.
post.description: This function allows users to post a new tweet on the X platform. It supports various options including text content, media attachments, polls, reply settings, and more. The function returns a promise that resolves to the created tweet data.

body.description: Body of the create sls call

items.description: TweetCreate object containing the tweet content and options

text.description: The text content of the tweet

card_uri.description: The URI of a card to attach to the tweet

community_id.description: The ID of the community to post the tweet to

direct_message_deep_link.description: A deep link to a direct message

for_super_followers_only.description: Whether the tweet is for super followers only

place_id.description: The ID of the place to attach to the tweet

media.description: Media information to attach to the tweet

media_ids.description: An array of media IDs to attach to the tweet

tagged_user_ids.description: An array of user IDs to tag in the media

nullcast.description: Whether the tweet is a nullcast

duration_minutes.description: The duration of the poll in minutes (min: 5, max: 10080)

reply_settings.description: The reply settings for the poll

quote_tweet_id.description: The ID of the tweet to quote

in_reply_to_tweet_id.description: The ID of the tweet being replied to

exclude_reply_user_ids.description: An array of user IDs to exclude from the reply

reply_settings.description: The reply settings for the tweet

id.description: The unique identifier of the tweet

text.description: The text content of the tweet

created_at.description: The creation time of the tweet

author_id.description: The ID of the author of the tweet

edit_history_tweet_ids.description: An array of previous tweet IDs

error.description: Error message describing the bad request
Error message describing the server error

post.summary: Retrieves a single tweet by its ID from X.
post.description: This function fetches a specific tweet from X using its unique identifier. It allows for optional expansions to be included in the response, providing flexibility in the data retrieved. The function returns a promise that resolves to the tweet data, including details such as the tweet's text, creation time, and author information.

body.description: Body of the get sls call

items.description: The ID of the tweet to retrieve.
Additional options for the tweet retrieval.

expansions.description: An array of expansions to include in the response.

id.description: The unique identifier of the tweet.

text.description: The text content of the tweet.

created_at.description: The creation time of the tweet.

author_id.description: The ID of the author of the tweet.

edit_history_tweet_ids.description: An array of previous tweet IDs.

detail.description: A detailed description of the error.

status.description: The HTTP status code of the error.

error.description: Error message describing the bad request.
Error message describing the server error.

post.summary: Retrieves multiple tweets by their IDs from X (formerly Twitter) in a single request.
post.description: The getMultiple function fetches multiple tweets from X using their unique identifiers. It allows for efficient retrieval of up to 100 tweets in a single API call, with optional parameters for expanding the returned data. This function is useful for bulk tweet retrieval operations.

body.description: Body of the getMultiple sls call

items.description: An array of tweet IDs to retrieve. Must contain between 1 and 100 IDs.
Additional options for the tweet retrieval

expansions.description: An array of expansions to include in the response

200.description: Successful response containing the requested tweets

id.description: The unique identifier of the tweet

text.description: The text content of the tweet

created_at.description: The creation time of the tweet

author_id.description: The ID of the author of the tweet

edit_history_tweet_ids.description: An array of previous tweet IDs

detail.description: A detailed description of the error

status.description: The HTTP status code of the error

error.description: Error message describing the issue with the request
Error message indicating a server-side issue

post.summary: Deletes a tweet by its ID.
post.description: This function removes a specific tweet from X using its unique identifier. It returns a promise that resolves to a deletion confirmation object, which includes information about whether the tweet was successfully deleted and any errors that may have occurred during the process.

body.description: Body of the delete sls call

items.description: The ID of the tweet to delete.

deleted.description: True if the tweet was deleted, false otherwise

detail.description: A detailed description of the error

status.description: The HTTP status code of the error

error.description: Error message describing the bad request
Error message describing the server error

post.summary: Retrieves a single user by their username from X.
post.description: This function fetches a specific user from X using their username. It allows for optional expansions to be included in the response. The function returns a promise that resolves to the user data, including various user attributes and public metrics.

body.description: Body of the getByUsername sls call

items.description: The username of the user to retrieve.
Additional options for the request.

expansions.description: An array of expansions to include in the response.

id.description: The unique identifier of the user

created_at.description: The creation time of the user's account

protected.description: Whether the user's tweets are protected

profile_image_url.description: The URL of the user's profile image

verified_type.description: The type of verification the user has

followers_count.description: The number of followers the user has

following_count.description: The number of users the user is following

tweet_count.description: The number of tweets the user has posted

listed_count.description: The number of lists the user is included in

detail.description: A detailed description of the error

status.description: The HTTP status code of the error

post.summary: Retrieve multiple users by their usernames
post.description: This function fetches multiple users from X using their usernames. It allows for retrieving information about up to 100 users in a single request, with optional expansions for additional data. The function returns detailed user information including profile data and public metrics.

body.description: Body of the getByUsernames sls call

items.description: An array of usernames to retrieve
Additional options for the request

expansions.description: An array of expansions to include in the response

id.description: The unique identifier of the user

created_at.description: The creation time of the user's account

protected.description: Whether the user's tweets are protected

profile_image_url.description: The URL of the user's profile image

verified_type.description: The type of verification the user has

followers_count.description: The number of followers the user has

following_count.description: The number of users the user is following

tweet_count.description: The number of tweets the user has posted

listed_count.description: The number of lists the user is included in

detail.description: A detailed description of the error

status.description: The HTTP status code of the error

post.summary: Retrieves a single user by their ID from X.
post.description: This function fetches a specific user from X using their unique ID. It allows for optional expansions to include additional data in the response. The function returns a promise that resolves to the user data, including various user attributes and metrics.

body.description: Body of the getById sls call

items.description: The ID of the user to retrieve.
Additional options for the request.

expansions.description: An array of expansions to include in the response.

id.description: The unique identifier of the user.

created_at.description: The creation time of the user's account.

protected.description: Whether the user's tweets are protected.

profile_image_url.description: The URL of the user's profile image.

verified_type.description: The type of verification the user has.

followers_count.description: The number of followers the user has.

following_count.description: The number of users the user is following.

tweet_count.description: The number of tweets the user has posted.

listed_count.description: The number of lists the user is included in.

detail.description: A detailed description of the error.

status.description: The HTTP status code of the error.

error.description: Error message describing the bad request.
Error message describing the server error.

post.summary: Retrieves multiple users by their IDs from X.
post.description: This function fetches multiple users from X using their unique IDs. It allows for optional expansions to include additional data in the response. The function returns a promise that resolves to an object containing an array of user data and optional error information.

body.description: Body of the getByIds sls call

items.description: An array of user IDs to retrieve
Additional options for the request

expansions.description: An array of expansions to include in the response

id.description: The unique identifier of the user

created_at.description: The creation time of the user's account

protected.description: Whether the user's tweets are protected

profile_image_url.description: The URL of the user's profile image

verified_type.description: The type of verification the user has

followers_count.description: The number of followers the user has

following_count.description: The number of users the user is following

tweet_count.description: The number of tweets the user has posted

listed_count.description: The number of lists the user is included in

detail.description: A detailed description of the error

status.description: The HTTP status code of the error

error.description: Error message describing the bad request
Error message describing the server error

post.description: This function fetches the user associated with the provided access token. It returns detailed information about the authenticated user, including their profile data and public metrics. The function also supports optional expansions for additional data retrieval.

body.description: Body of the getMe sls call

items.description: Additional options for the request

expansions.description: An array of expansions to include in the response

id.description: The unique identifier of the user

created_at.description: The creation time of the user's account

protected.description: Whether the user's tweets are protected

profile_image_url.description: The URL of the user's profile image

verified_type.description: The type of verification the user has

followers_count.description: The number of followers the user has

following_count.description: The number of users the user is following

tweet_count.description: The number of tweets the user has posted

listed_count.description: The number of lists the user is included in

detail.description: A detailed description of the error

status.description: The HTTP status code of the error

post.summary: Uploads media to X (formerly Twitter) for attaching to tweets.
post.description: This function uploads a media file to X, which can then be attached to a tweet. It takes a Buffer object containing the media file and its MIME type as input. The function returns a promise that resolves to a MediaUploadResponse object containing details about the uploaded media.

body.description: Body of the upload sls call

items.description: The media file as a Buffer object
The MIME type of the media file (e.g., "image/jpeg", "video/mp4")

media_id.description: The media ID as a number

media_id_string.description: The media ID as a string

size.description: The size of the media file in bytes

expires_after_secs.description: The number of seconds until the uploaded media expires

error.description: Error message describing the bad request
Error message describing the server error

post.summary: Generates an OAuth 1.0a header for authenticating requests to the X API.
post.description: This function creates the Authorization header required for making authenticated requests to X. It takes the HTTP method, full URL, and optional additional parameters to generate a valid OAuth 1.0a header string.

body.description: Body of the generateOAuthHeader sls call

items.description: The HTTP method (e.g., 'GET', 'POST')
The full URL of the request
Additional parameters to include in the signature

error.description: Error message describing the issue with the request
Error message indicating a server-side issue
